Authors:
Digvijayini Bundhun, Dhanushka Nadeeshan Wanasinghe,
Maharachchikumbura Sandeshya Maharachchikumbura, Jayarama D. Bhat,
Shi-Ke Huang, Saisamorn Lumyong, Peter E Mortimer, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
Yuxiensis granularis gen. et sp. nov., a novel
quellkörper-bearing taxon added to Scortechiniaceae and inclusion of
Parasympodiellaceae in Coronophorales based on phylogenetic
evidence
Keywords:
2 new taxa; 1 new combination; Hypocreomycetidae;
phylogeny; Sordariomycetes; Yunnan
Abstract:
An undetermined saprobic taxon from Yunnan (China) is
revealed as a new genus in Scortechini-aceae (Coronophorales). The novel
taxon, Yuxiensis, is distinctly characterised by immersed to erumpent,
semi-globose ascomata, which are not surrounded by any tomentum or
conspicuous subiculum, a subcylindrical quellkörper in the centrum,
clavate asci with long pedicels and al-lantoid hyaline ascospores with
granular contents. Maximum likelihood and Bayesian posterior probability
analyses based on LSU, ITS, tef1 and rpb2 sequence data depict a close
phylogenetic relationship of the new genus to Pseudocatenomycopsis,
hence, confirming its placement in Scor-techiniaceae.
Parasympodiellaceae, thus far belonging to Parasympodiellales, is
transferred to Coro-nophorales based on multi-gene phylogenetic
evidence. Additionally, the incertae sedis monotypic genus
Arthrocristula is treated as a synonym of Parasympodiella, with
Arthrocristula hyphenata re-combined as Parasympodiella hyphenata comb.
nov., as the ex-type strain of Arthrocristula hyphenata clusters inside
the Parasympodiellaceae clade along with other Parasympodiella
taxa.
